comment.author: 29350288@N06
comment._content:
Enrique Robles was a toreador. This is presumably from his time in the New York area, 1913.   

Eg: "George C. Tilyou of Steeplechase Park will offer as a special attraction Senor Enrique Robles, the champion bullfighter of Spain and Mexico, who has been engaged with his company of forty bandartillos, matadors and toreadors, besides a number of Mexicans horsemen and American cowboys, and will give exhibitions of bullfighting, exactly as in Spain, with the elimination of all brutal features." NY Times, September 7, 1913.

comment.author: 51125929@N00
comment._content: Haha. Way to suck in the gut!

comment._content: odd that his wrist and hand appear to be shaven. Is that something to do with toreador-ing?
